channel.title: IP Banned? HA!
channel.description:
Ok, this is just a little tut for those who haven't found it yet. :cool:
So here's what you do.. Open up signlink.java.
Search: [CODE] public static final synchronized void dnslookup(String s) { dns = s; //comment out this dnsreq = s; //and this }[/CODE]
Then in client.java search: [CODE]signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());[/CODE]
Comment that out or just delete it.
Done! This might possibly be useful for Aryan users that are paranoid about it and have to use SOCKS5 proxys. So there.

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

you know what you guys should try? make two new names, then(before doing anything on them) log in with one, but have your client send the otehr ones information, then in the middle switch back to the stuff you typed in, and see what happens

just wondering what would happen

Read full topic

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:5, topic:833”]Hehe… I doubt it though.

Ithink this’ll work because when you do it, the “you last logged in from” is null. I don’t see why they’d have the server configured to do that when the client does it.[/quote]
Perhaps they take it as an error. Like, perhaps this is a caught exception when it doesn’t recieve your DNS info.

Read full topic

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

Banning, IP logging or anything of that matter is serverside.
All it might do is verify that the IP the client has is the same as the IP the server has – Which actually leads into another trap dealing with proxies.

Read full topic

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @Calvin Calvin
item.description:
@Calvin wrote:

You could never be invincible to bannage.

They would ban your account, not the client, so they’d edit their database, and say you are banned.

Read full topic

but he put it inside white castle’s quote, instead of outside, cause he doesnt know where to type rofl

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Aight daiki. I just thought it might work because I wasn’t getting anything on the login.

And xerox, you just get ‘Unexpected server response’.

Read full topic

item.title: IP Banned? HA!
item.dc:creator: @daiki daiki
item.description:
@daiki wrote:

The dnslookup method has always been there. It will get the DNS name for the “last logged in” IP, which is stored on the server. So when the server tells you that you last logged in from for example “82.131.218.41” (Just made up a random IP) it will change it clientside to show as “82.131.218.41.pool.invitel.hu” on the login screen.

So this thing is not a trap or anything, and changing it will not affect you getting banned in any way

Read full topic

@White_Castle wrote:

Ok, this is just a little tut for those who haven’t found it yet.

So here’s what you do… Open up signlink.java.

Search:

public static final synchronized void dnslookup(String s) { dns = s; //comment out this dnsreq = s; //and this }

Then in client.java search:

signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost());

Comment that out or just delete it.
